meanings.definition: The act of supplying electricity to an area or system.
meanings.sent1: The electrification of the village brought light to every home.
meanings.sent2: The government invested in the electrification of rural areas.
meanings.sent3: The electrification of the town made the mayor very popular.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the electrification of a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The electrification of the city was celebrated with fireworks.

meanings.definition: The process of converting a system or area to use electricity.
meanings.sent1: The electrification of the train system improved efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The company initiated the electrification of their manufacturing plant.
meanings.sent3: The electrification of the old building was a shocking success.
meanings.sent4: His words had the electrification effect of sparking new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The electrification of the school was a bright idea.

meanings.definition: The state of being powered by electricity.
meanings.sent1: The electrification of the house made life easier.
meanings.sent2: The electrification of the car industry revolutionized transportation.
meanings.sent3: The electrification of the office led to a surge in productivity.
meanings.sent4: Her presence had an electrification effect on the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The electrification of the stadium lit up the night sky.
